contest-event.event-date: April 12, 1898 D Intercolonial Band Contest Intercolonial Band Contest 0 Other Intercolonial Band Contest intercolonial-band-contest Although an earlier contest in Sydney in 1880 had borne the same title, the Band Association of NSW ran its inaugural "Intercolonial Band Contest" in 1896. The second event, in 1897, was advertised as for the "Championship of Australasia", and is considered to be the first in the sequence of Australian national championships (noting that the federation of Australia did not occur until 1901). Melbourne Town Hall, Melbourne, Victoria, Australia First 2 bands had a play-off to decide winner. Drill contest - 1st Launceston, 2nd Eaglehawk, 3rd Oamaru. 8 bands competed. Jan. 27, 2020, 10:19 a.m. Jan. 27, 2020, 1:02 p.m. 1 Code's Band Edward Code 2 NSW Railway Military Band Charles Helm 3 Oamaru Garrison Band W. S. King 3 Sydney Model Jack Devlin 4 Eaglehawk Citizens Band Unknown 5 Launceston City Band Unknown 6 Albury City Unknown 7 Northcott City ( Bendigo ) Unknown
